alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lincoln; McDuffie (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 7:37PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following areas, in east central Georgia, Columbia, Lincoln and McDuffie. In central South Carolina, Edgefield, McCormick and Saluda. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 737 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Evans, Thomson, Edgefield, McCormick, Harlem, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Hamilton Branch State Park, Riverwood, Mistletoe State Park, Appling, Mccormick County Airport, Thomson-McDuffie County Airport, Wrightsboro, Dearing, Parksville, Plum Branch, Bussey Point Campground, Lake Springs Recreation Area and Modoc. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 167 and 189. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don`t drown.
